# Checklist: Initial Case Triage

<!-- This checklist provides a systematic approach to initial case assessment in contentious probate matters -->

## Purpose

To ensure comprehensive and systematic initial assessment of contentious probate matters, identifying key issues, risks, and required actions from the outset.

## When to Use

- At first client contact
- Before opening new matter file
- During initial client meeting
- Before providing initial advice on merits

---

## Section 1: Conflict and Compliance Checks

### Conflict of Interest

- [ ] **Conflict check run against all parties**
  - Client name: ___________________________
  - Deceased name: ___________________________
  - All potential defendants: ___________________________
  - All known beneficiaries: ___________________________
  - Executors/administrators: ___________________________

- [ ] **Positional conflicts considered**
  - No conflict with other contentious probate matters
  - No conflict with non-contentious probate work
  - No conflict with trust/estate administration work

- [ ] **Conflict outcome:**
  - [ ] No conflict - proceed
  - [ ] Conflict identified - obtain waiver/decline
  - [ ] Uncertain - escalate to supervisor

### Client Identity and AML Compliance

- [ ] **Client identity verified** (AML requirements)
  - [ ] Photographic ID obtained (passport/driving license)
  - [ ] Proof of address obtained (utility bill/bank statement)
  - [ ] ID verification form completed
  - [ ] Source of funds for payment identified

- [ ] **Enhanced due diligence** (if required)
  - [ ] PEP check completed
  - [ ] Sanctions check completed
  - [ ] Additional verification obtained

### Retainer and Client Care

- [ ] **Client care letter sent** - Date: ___________
- [ ] **Terms of business accepted** - Date: ___________
- [ ] **Retainer agreement signed** - Date: ___________
- [ ] **Costs agreement in place** - Date: ___________
- [ ] **Funding arrangements confirmed**
- [ ] **Complaints procedure explained**

---

## Section 2: Limitation and Urgency

### Critical Deadlines

- [ ] **Limitation period identified**
  
  **For Inheritance Act claims:**
  - Date of death: ___________
  - Date of grant: ___________
  - **6-month deadline: ___________**
  - Time remaining: ___________
  - **Urgency level: [ ] CRITICAL [ ] HIGH [ ] MEDIUM [ ] LOW**

  **For other claims:**
  - Nature of claim: ___________________________
  - Applicable limitation period: ___________
  - Limitation expiry date: ___________
  - Time remaining: ___________

- [ ] **Limitation deadline diarized** with multiple reminders
- [ ] **Supervisor notified** if deadline is imminent (less than 3 months)
- [ ] **Client advised** of limitation position in writing

### Other Urgent Matters

- [ ] **Risk of asset dissipation?**
  - [ ] No
  - [ ] Yes - consider caveat/injunction
  - Action required: ___________________________

- [ ] **Health/vulnerability issues requiring expedition?**
  - [ ] No
  - [ ] Yes - specify: ___________________________

- [ ] **Other urgency factors:** ___________________________

---

- Legal representation (if known): ___________________________

[Continue for all known parties]

- [ ] **All executors/administrators identified**
- [ ] **Other potential claimants identified**

List: ___________________________

## Section 9: Costs and Funding

### Estimated Costs

- To exchange of witness statements: £___________
- To trial: £___________
- Disbursements (expert, court fees): £___________
- Total estimated costs: £___________

### Client Funding

**Client's ability to fund:**
- [ ] Can fund privately
- [ ] Requires funding arrangement
- [ ] Limited means - funding uncertain

**Funding option recommended:**
- [ ] Private funding (hourly rate)
- [ ] Conditional Fee Agreement (CFA)
- [ ] Damages-Based Agreement (DBA)
- [ ] After the Event (ATE) insurance
- [ ] Before the Event (BTE) insurance
- [ ] Estate funding
- [ ] Legal aid (if available)
- [ ] Other: ___________________________

### Costs Risks

**Costs risk to client if unsuccessful:**

- Our own costs: £___________
- Opponent's costs (estimate): £___________
- Total exposure: £___________

**Risk mitigation:**
- [ ] ATE insurance recommended
- [ ] Costs budget to be prepared
- [ ] Costs warnings given to client
- [ ] Costs protection in settlement to be sought

---

## Section 10: Risk Assessment

### Overall Risk Rating

- [ ] **HIGH RISK** - Significant risks requiring senior oversight
- [ ] **MEDIUM RISK** - Moderate risks, normal supervision adequate
- [ ] **LOW RISK** - Limited risks

### Specific Risks Identified

**Limitation Risk:**
- Level: [ ] High [ ] Medium [ ] Low
- Mitigation: ___________________________

**Merit/Prospects Risk:**
- Level: [ ] High [ ] Medium [ ] Low
- Mitigation: ___________________________

**Client Risk:**
- Level: [ ] High [ ] Medium [ ] Low
- Nature: ___________________________
- Mitigation: ___________________________

**Costs Risk:**
- Level: [ ] High [ ] Medium [ ] Low
- Mitigation: ___________________________

**Reputational Risk:**
- Level: [ ] High [ ] Medium [ ] Low
- Nature: ___________________________

**Opponent Risk:**
- Level: [ ] High [ ] Medium [ ] Low
- Nature: ___________________________

### Risk Register

- [ ] **Risk register created for this matter**
- [ ] **High risks escalated to supervisor**
- [ ] **Client advised of material risks**

## Section 13: File Setup and Administration

### Matter Details

- **Matter opened:** Date: ___________
- **Matter number:** ___________________________
- **Fee earner:** ___________________________
- **Supervisor:** ___________________________
- **Billing arrangements:** ___________________________

### File Organization

- [ ] **Physical file** opened and indexed
- [ ] **Electronic file** created in DMS
- [ ] **File structure** established per standards
- [ ] **File naming conventions** applied

### Deadline Management

- [ ] **Limitation deadline** diarized with reminders
- [ ] **Client review date** diarized (28 days)
- [ ] **Supervisor review date** diarized (7 days)
- [ ] **Other key deadlines** diarized

### Quality Assurance

- [ ] **Initial file review** scheduled (within 7 days)
- [ ] **Risk assessment** documented
- [ ] **Supervisor notified** of case opening
- [ ] **High risk matters** escalated appropriately
